Key Arguments: The government should not be the arbiter of truth or censor dissenting opinions.
Open and honest debate is the solution to misinformation, not government intervention.
The proposed bill threatens freedom of speech and democracy.
The bill represents government overreach and could lead to authoritarianism.
The legislation contradicts Australia's strong stance on human rights and constitutional freedoms.
Notable Quotes: The answer is not to make the government the arbiter of truth and to censor those it disagrees with.
The proposed bill will not progress Australia but regress it and suppress our freedoms and liberties given to us by our constitution.
When loyalty to the government and its version of truth is the supreme virtue, we cross the threshold into totalitarianism, corruption and tyranny.
